title.narrative: Business support services (BUSAC III)

description.narrative: BUSAC III enhances and provides support to the capacity of private sector organisations to advocate business enabling reforms in laws, policies and regulations in Ghana and extends platforms for dialogue with relevant public sector stakeholders.

mailing-address.narrative: Dr. Isert Road 67, (8th Avenue Extension) North Ridge

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation

title.narrative: Outcome 1.2: Increased labour productivity, turnover and product quality through a demand-driven skills development fund.

Indicator 1.2: (a) Formal sector: % Increase in productivity by enterprises supported through SDF II
(b) Informal sector: % increase in the value added by enterprises supported through SDF II
(c) Agriculture sector: % increase in yield in agriculture produce by enterprises supported through SDF II
Output 6: SDF II experience and material made available to the public
Indicator 6.1: % of course materials developed with SDF funding made public through data bank
Output 3: Managers and supervisors trained and coached on staff development and production planning
Indicator 3.2: % of SDF II-supported manager/supervisors’ trainings conducted covering environmental, health, safety and gender issues
Output 2: New innovative skills training courses developed and delivered

Indicator 2.3: % of participants satisfied with the quality and relevance of the new innovative training courses they received from SDF II supported training institutions (Window 3) – disaggregated by sex.
Output 6: SDF II experience and material made available to the public
Indicator 6.2: Number of documents developed on environmental, gender equality and health & safety standards with SDF II funding

Indicator 4.1: # COTVET staff trained to conduct capacity assessments of training institutions, plan and implement training-of-trainer programmes and assist planned training activities
Output 1: Skills level of supported enterprises enhanced through demand responsive quality training
Indicator 1.5: Number of SDF supported enterprises with environmental, health, safety and gender policies.

Indicator 4.2: % Increase in satisfaction level of training institutions interacting with COTVET in relation to the guidance and support received

Output 6.1 : % of course material developed with SDF funding made public through data bank

All Courses materials including training manuals, handouts and books developed with SDF II supported made accessible to the public through an online databank. Number of course materials uploaded online as a percentage of total course materials generated by SDF II support. Unit of Measurement: Percent
